text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This transmits revised IRM 4.71.17, Employee Plans Examination of Returns, Non-Return Unit Examination Procedures.
Reorganized IRM 4.71.17.1(4), Program Authority.
Modiﬁed IRM 4.71.17.1.2 (1) to omit the reference to EP Examinations establishment of the review

Modiﬁed IRM 4.71.17.1.2 (3) to update the Taxpayer Bill of Rights (TBOR) content based on guidance from the Division Counsel/Associate Chief Counsel (National Taxpayer Advocate Program) and Branch 3 of the Associate Chief Counsel. (Procedure and Administration).
Renamed IRM 4.71.1.4, Contact Information for Individuals and Business Units to Related Resources and added additional resources.
Revised IRM 4.71.17.1.5 to include the privacy policy on safeguarding SBU and PII data and add reference to IRM 10.5.1, Privacy and Information Protection, Privacy Policy.
Updated the example in IRM 4.71.17.2(9) to conform to the ﬁctionalization requirements recently published Office of Privacy, Governmental Liaison and Disclosure (PGLD).
Revised IRM 4.71.17.3(3) to include information regarding IDRS Research.
Added IRM 4.71.17.6.1(8) to provide instructions on how to established a Form 5329 to assess IRC 4973 excise tax.
Revised IRM 4.71.17.7 to include additional Guidance and remove obsolete procedures.
Added IRM 4.71.17.8.1 to provide guidance on completing the RCCMS Closing Record.
Modiﬁed IRM 4.71.17.11(4) to update the location of the CECA Checksheet.

Revised IRM 4.71.17 to incorporate the provisions of the July 28, 2020, Interim Guidance Memorandum (IGM) TEGE-04-0720-0014 with the subject line, Interim Guidance on Fully Electronic (100% Paperless) Cases, from the Director, EP Examinations.

Revised IRM 4.71.17 to incorporate the provisions of the September 22, 2020, IGM TEGE-04-0920- 0021 with the subject line, Interim Guidance on Reporting Compliance Case Management System (RCCMS) Electronic Case Policy, from the Deputy Commissioner, TEGE.

) Purpose : IRM

, Employee Plans Examination of Returns, Non-Return Unit Examination Procedures, provides the basic examination procedures that will enable Employee Plans (EP) examiners and their managers to examine plans that have no ﬁling requirements. (
) Audience : This IRM provides procedures for examiners, managers, and support staff in EP Examinations. (
) Program Owner : Director, EP Examinations. (
) Program Authority : EP Examinations derives its authority to conduct exami- nations, resolve issues and determine tax liability from Title
, Internal Revenue Code, Subtitle F – Procedure and Administration, which includes is not limited to:
) EP Examinations has the responsibility to ensure that retirement plans are qualiﬁed under IRC
and the underlying regulations, and that the related trust is exempt from tax under IRC
) The EP Examinations program’s primary purpose is regulatory, with emphasis on continued qualiﬁcation of employee beneﬁt plans. See IRM
, Policy Statement

The IRS selects and examines returns to: a. Promote the highest degree of voluntary compliance with the tax laws governing plan qualiﬁcation. b. Determine the extent of compliance and the causes of noncompliance with the tax laws. c. Determine whether such plans meet the applicable qualiﬁcation require- ments in operation. (

) EP examiners and managers: a. Have broad authority to consider and weigh conﬂicting information, data, and opinions. b. Use professional judgment when applying examination standards for ﬁndings of fact and application of tax law to determine the correct tax liability.

Have broad authority to consider and weigh conﬂicting information, data, and opinions. Use professional judgment when applying examination standards for ﬁndings of fact and application of tax law to determine the correct tax liability.

(a) in that the IRS doesn’t issue individual plan rulings for qualiﬁcation for IRA-based plans. IRS doesn’t deem subsequent plan years as automatically disqualiﬁed, as we do with a
(a) plan. (
